description: Join our HelloFresh family At HelloFresh we love food and our mission is to change the way people eat forever. That change comes conveniently packaged in a box - a HelloFresh Box, filled with the best fresh ingredients. With our meal boxes with easy to cook recipes and fresh ingredients, we are driving change in the quickly evolving food industry. From developing our recipes to delivering the boxes - the customer is at the center of everything we do. Our aim is to make every meal a moment to look forward to, for everyone at the table. No surprise then that data is our friend and for us, learning never stops. We make quick but informed decisions and as a fast-growing company, we value flexibility and speed. We need you For our young and passionate team, we are looking for a business development intern starting in August. Working in the Business Development & Business Intelligence (BDBI) team, you are supporting the growth of HelloFresh – from analysis to implementation. You will analyze huge chunks of data and provide tangible opportunities that touch upon all teams from procurement to marketing. For larger projects, you will support the business analysts in doing analyses and coordinating on project management, giving you the change to really develop yourself. You'll be working on: Analyze customer behavior and provide recommendations for improvement. Questions you will answer are "Why do customers decide to pause?" and "How is our current performance in France?" Manage projects from the beginning to end. Examples of projects are gathering more customer data via 1 on 1 interviews and benchmark our performance against competitors. Support business analysts during bigger projects, such as country roll-outs and new product introductions. Are you our perfect new colleague? For this internship, you on the one hand have excellent analysis skills so that you can crunch the numbers while at the same time having the social skills to make projects happen. You have experience in data analysis with for example Excel or Python. In addition, you like to work together with colleagues to get the most out of projects and have proven to be a great collaborator during previous internships and/or extra curricular activities. Lastly, you enjoy leaving your mark on HelloFresh and take ownership to get things done. What do we offer you? Make a serious impact on the growth of HelloFresh A lot of learning- and development opportunities within a young and dynamic e-commerce company; Freedom of idea and initiative, execution and implementation of your own ideas and initiatives; You can make use of the company benefits, which is the current situation means bootcamp sessions in the park, virtual meditations and online pub quizzes and game nights with colleagues; Next, to that, you also get a discount on the HelloFresh box; And of course, you'll earn a compensation of 500 EUR gross per month, based on a 40-hour work week. We hear you thinking, what to do if I'm interested? Well, after applying we take a look at your resume and cover letter. If we see a match, we will invite you for an online interview. Are we still positive? We will schedule a video interview with the team. We will schedule the interviews one after the other quickly, in order to let you know as fast as possible if you can start at HelloFresh! And, yes, very important: we celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. Let's apply! Nice, good choice! Please click on the 'apply' button below and fill out the mandatory fields. Upload your resume and cover letter and that's it. Applications sent by email will not be processed. Before applying please make sure you are eligible to work in the Netherlands, unfortunately, we do not sponsor any work visa or permits for this position. We'd like to recruit for our own vacancies with our own resources. If we would like your help, we will reach out to you.

Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  Are you the experienced Medior Data Analyst to help create Mendix’s analytics center of excellence? Do you have a good view on what an analytics center of excellence within a pioneering tech company should look like? Then we are looking for you.  What is our analytics center of excellence (COE)?  Mendix has doubled in size in only a year and a half. As such, the need for analytics insights and automation are becoming increasingly important. The analytics center of excellence will be providing different business units with dedicated partners that create new analytics products and insights to improve the performance of their units and make the rights decisions.  The COE is supported by a technical data engineering team who are responsible for the Mendix’s data landscape (think datalake & data warehouse). The COE is still relatively small and currently consists of 4 analysts, however analytics has been recognized as an incredibly important area of investment by Mendix’s management. Therefor we will be hiring several new analysts in the COE this year and hope to more than double the size of the team by the end of the year.  What job would you be applying for?  The role of a Medior Data Analyst varies quite a bit per organization. In our case, we’re looking for people that can partner up with the business and come up with solutions and insights that will help them make better decisions and become more efficient. As a data analyst in the COE you will be dedicated to a specific business unit. You will also support another analyst as a backup for a second business unit. You will work closely together with that unit to learn the domain knowledge necessary to help create useful analytics solutions together with them.  Mentoring other members of the COE and helping build the foundation of our COE best practices will also be an important part of your role. We are looking for people with new ideas and several years of analytics experience that can help enrich the COE.  About you:  You are a Medior Data Analyst that can help shape our new center of excellence. Our team of analysts is relatively young, therefore we are looking for people that can bring industry best practices into the COE and have several years of experience working in an agile work environment. If you have several years of experience in a data analytics related role and you are eager to bring your experience in a young, thriving, and quickly scaling organization, then you are the person we are looking for! A handful of activities that you can expect to be working on throughout a normal work week: Scoping and challenging analytics requests from the business; Brainstorming about new ideas for the business; Helping the business define, create and operationalize their KPIs; Building operational and management level dashboards in Power BI; Transforming data using SQL, R or Python; Designing and doing in depth research with large raw datasets; Applying statistical techniques to metrics and hypotheses to prove significance of results; Presenting your findings and actionable recommendations or analytics products to the business; Coming up with enablement strategies for analytics products; Mentoring and teaching younger members of the COE; Introducing new techniques, tools, and best practices for the COE. Technical requirements: KPI creation, target setting, forecasting, operationalization; Data processing languages or scripting languages such as: SQL, R or Python; BI tooling such as Power BI, Tableau, QlikSense or BI dashboard creation using languages such as Python or Shiny Research and hypothesis design; Creating, implementing, releasing, and enabling the business in using analytics products such as: automated health score or priority systems, account based marketing, smart chat bots, automated notifications triggered by changes in metrics, forecasting models, prediction models, clustering systems, or other analytics related techniques or products;  Business requirements: Experience with low code (app) development; Experience (5+ years) with presenting analytics solutions or actionable insights from research to management; Experience presenting analytics solutions or actionable insights from research to high level executives; Experience with working in an agile scrum environment; Experience with gathering requirements from the business; Experience with challenging business partners to uncover the right requirements and clearly scope requests or ideas; Experience with quickly learning about and familiarizing yourself with different business domains; Experience with stakeholder management between different business units and management levels; Experience with mentoring and/or teaching subject matter to colleagues; Able to speak fluent English; Speaking Dutch is a plus. Personal character traits: A good understanding of business needs and the ability to act accordingly, taking measured risks into account and the ability to take the organization to a next maturity level; The ability to remain fully functional by adapting to changing circumstances (environment, procedures, people). Absorb new information readily and to put it into practice effectively; Assertiveness; the ability to bring one’s views across clearly without damaging the relationship with stakeholders; Creativity; the ability to come up with original and innovative ideas and solutions, to adopt points of view outside the usual parameters; The ability to ask further with the ambition to deeply understand other perspectives and views in order to generate support. Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.

Global research in gaming and digital media has been in Newzoo’s core for almost a decade. With the demand for digital media growing rapidly, so does the demand for data on their consumers. As Research Intern, you will assist Newzoo’s data team carry out studies on games, tech, digital media, and other relevant topics. You’ll be involved in every aspect of the project, from writing and programming surveys to managing fieldwork and processing the data. Next to this, you’ll assist with data analysis, reporting, and be presenting the results visually, getting them ready to be delivered to Newzoo’s clients.  For this internship, you will be required to work from our Amsterdam office* at least 32 hours per week. The internship can be combined with a research or personal development project while enrolled at an educational institution, but that is not mandatory.  Your Responsibilities  Keeping track of developments in the games, tech, and digital media industries Analyzing data from various sources, help creating reports, and presenting results in a visually appealing format according to Newzoo’s design guidelines Assisting in online consumer research, programming and testing surveys, and processing data Providing your expertise on client or partner challenges Managing your research or development assignment  Your Profile  Bachelor or Master student enrolled in Business Administration, Psychology, Marketing, Market Research course, or relevant field Affinity with internet and digital media (a strong interest in video games, in particular, is a plus) Experience with data analysis tools and/or data processing Strong analytical and statistical skills, can answer client questions independently with statistically sound advice based on the available data Ability to work independently, problem solver, eager to learn Good PowerPoint and Excel skills Ability to work in Amsterdam (Newzoo does not assist in getting a valid work permit to work in the Netherlands) Available for 4-6 months, starting asap  Our Offer  A workplace overlooking the harbour of Amsterdam An internship with a very international outlook in a dynamic, ever-changing and fun industry Includes lunch and an internship compensation Plenty of room to develop yourself and shape your career Be part of a fast-growing, ambitious, young, and energetic team

Maykers is an online platform that facilitates smart connections between farmers and their partners to make the business of farming successful. We make it simple to sell, find and buy professional products based on fair prices and clear conditions. We’re a team that cultivates service excellence, growth and teamwork. Together with an international team of around 50 people we have the common goal to make farmers’ business run smoothly. For our fresh and fast-growing eCommerce start-up, we are looking for a smart, results-oriented and communicative Business Analyst to strengthen our team!  Your mission:  In this job you play an important role in scaling up our business and specifically in translating business needs into IT solutions. You will be part of the scaling up our digital marketplace and our international expansion into more European markets. You will enable stakeholders to formulate their wishes, unravel the requirements, structure them and you ensure that it can be built by our development teams. You will be investigating and performing data analysis and making recommendations for solving problems. This is not an average BA job. You will come across an environment that is quite complex and includes many different stakeholders at different levels. But who can beat a challenge as beautiful as this? You are not taking on this challenge alone. You work closely with the Product owner, the Scrum teams and our Marketing team.  What will you bring to the table:  We are looking for someone who preferably has experience in an eCommerce (b2b / b2c) environment Bachelor or University degree with technological focus or equivalent work experience 3+ years of relevant practical experience Affinity and love for a fast-moving environment Ease and clarity in communication with both internal and external stakeholders Significant time spent as a Freelancer - you understand how to quickly pick up a project and run with it  You are:  Analytical: data tells a story and you use it to experiment, adjust, come up with the ideas and bring them to life Self-motivated and self-directed: you take the initiative, you can multitask and set priorities with little guidance Communicative: You build relationships easily and quickly with all stakeholders at different levels and different backgrounds - tech and non-tech  You would work in a scale-up environment and culture while having the solid funding and market power of a corporate You'd be joining a new platform that will revolutionize the agri industry in the next years You'd be joining a small team where every new teammate makes a lot of difference You'd be in an energetic and flexible place, perfect for developing yourself and improving your entrepreneurial skills We cherish a great working atmosphere with smart colleagues with a good sense of humor N.B. to Recruiters: at this stage we don't require any assistance for this role. If that changes we will reach out to you. Please don't contact anyone on our team prior to this.

Wie ben jij? Jij bent een expert op het gebied van inzichten halen uit data. Je bent een netwerker en vindt snel je weg binnen een organisatie. Daarnaast sta je open voor het gebruik van nieuwe technieken en analyses; Visualisatie technieken (bijvoorbeeld Tableau, Power BI) Ervaring met complexe datastructuren; Ervaring met het vertalen van data naar toepasbare inzichten. Wat bieden wij? Naast een goed salaris bieden wij jou: Een baan voor 32 of 36 uur per week per week, zodat je een goede werk-/privé balans hebt. Een interessante winstdeling- of bonusregeling, een laptop en iPhone, een mooie bijdrage aan je pensioen (als werkgever leggen wij 2/3 in), goede mogelijkheden tot persoonlijke ontwikkeling en groei (zowel in Nederland als in het buitenland) en een baan met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband. Daarnaast organiseren wij een jaarlijkse sportdag, een knallend eindejaarsfeest, gratis fruit en vooral veel werkplezier met leuke en professionele collega’s!
